casebody.data:
ROMULUS DEVELOPMENT CORP., PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. TOWNSHIP OF WEEHAWKEN, DEFENDANT-APPELLANT. ROMULUS DEVELOPMENT CORP., PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. TOWN OF WEST NEW YORK, DEFENDANT-APPELLANT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Submitted February 19, 1987 Decided March 5, 1987.

Before Judges FURMAN, DREIER and SHEBELL.

Venino & Venino, attorneys for the appellant Township of Weehawkin (Richard Venino of counsel and on the brief). Sidney I. Turtz, attorney for the appellant Town of West New York. McCarter & English, attorneys for respondent (William T. Reilly of counsel; Frank E. Ferruggia on the brief). PER CURIAM.

We affirm substantially for the reasons stated by Judge Lasser in his opinion published at 7 N.J.Tax 305 (Tax Ct.1985).
